sen.j: 有地 品之允（ありち しなのじょう、1843年4月14日（天保14年3月15日 (旧暦)） - 1919年（大正8年）1月17日）は日本の海軍軍人、政治家。
sen.e: Shinanojo ARICHI (有地 品之允, April 14, 1843 - January 17, 1919) was a Japanese naval officer and statesman.
Shinanojo ARICHI (April 14, 1843 - January 17, 1919) was a Japanese naval officer and statesman.
Shinanojo ARICHI (April 14, 1843 - January 17, 1919) was a Japanese naval officer and statesman.

sen.j: 中将、貴族院議員、男爵。
sen.e: He was a Lieutenant General, member of the House of Peers, and Baron.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「貴族院 (日本)」をWeb原稿に合わせて「貴族院議員」に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was a Lieutenant General, member of the House of Peers, and Baron.
He was a Lieutenant General, member of the House of Peers, and Baron.

sen.j: 別名・信政。
sen.e: His another name was Nobumasa.
His another name was Nobumasa.
His another name was Nobumasa.

sen.j: 海軍中将梨羽時起は弟、3男有地十五郎は海軍中将、嗣子有地藤三郎は海軍造兵大佐・貴族院議員。
sen.e: Vice Admiral Tokioki NASHIHA was his younger brother, his third son Jugoro ARICHI was Vice Admiral, and his heir Tozaburo ARICHI was Armory Captain and a member of the House of Peers.
sen.cmt: 「海軍造兵大佐」の正式な英語表記は未確認です。
sen.e: Vice Admiral Tokioki NASHIHA was his younger brother, his third son Jugoro ARICHI was Vice Admiral, and his heir Tozaburo ARICHI was Armory Captain and a member of the House of Peers.
Vice Admiral Tokioki NASHIHA was his younger brother, his third son Jugoro ARICHI was Vice Admiral, and his heir Tozaburo ARICHI was Armory Captain and a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 長州藩士で武術指南役（1000石）であった、有地藤馬の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the first son of Toma ARICHI who was a feudal retainer of the Choshu clan and a Bujutsu Shinan-yak (an instructor of a martial art) (1000 koku [180 cubic meters] of rice).
He was born as the first son of Toma ARICHI who was a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain and a Bujutsu Shinan-yak (an instructor of a martial art) (1000 koku [180 cubic meters] of rice).
sen.cmt: the Choshu clan→Choshu Domainに変更しました。
sen.e: He was born as the first son of Toma ARICHI who was a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain and a Bujutsu Shinan-yak (an instructor of a martial art) (1000 koku [180 cubic meters] of rice).

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では干城隊士として奥羽に出陣した。
sen.e: In Boshin Civil War, he went to the front of the Ou district as a member of Kanjo-tai.
In Boshin Civil War, he went to the front of the Ou district as a member of Kanjo-tai.
In Boshin Civil War, he went to the front of the Ou district as a member of Kanjo-tai.

sen.j: 1869年から1871年まで欧州へ出張して普仏戦争を視察。
sen.e: From 1869 to 1871, he stayed in Europe for an official purpose and made an inspection of the Franco-Prussian War.
From 1869 to 1871, he stayed in Europe for an official purpose and made an inspection of the Franco-Prussian War.
From 1869 to 1871, he stayed in Europe for an official purpose and made an inspection of the Franco-Prussian War.

sen.j: 帰国後に陸軍少佐、御親兵6番大隊長となり、同年から1873年まで侍従を務める。
sen.e: After he returned to Japan, he became Army Major and the sixth Battalion Chief of Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor), and from that year to 1873, he served as Jiju (Chamberlain).
After he returned to Japan, he became Army Major and the sixth Battalion Chief of Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor), and from that year to 1873, he served as Jiju (Chamberlain).
After he returned to Japan, he became Army Major and the sixth Battalion Chief of Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor), and from that year to 1873, he served as Jiju (Chamberlain).

sen.j: 1873年に海軍に転じ、海軍少佐となって提督府分課に勤務。
sen.e: In 1873, he was transferred to the navy, and as Lieutenant Commander he worked at the branch section of Admiral Office.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「鎮守府 (日本海軍)」をWeb原稿に合わせて「提督府」に訂正しました。「提督府分課」の正式な英語表記は未確認です。
sen.e: In 1873, he was transferred to the navy, and as Lieutenant Commander he worked at the branch section of Admiral Office.
In 1873, he was transferred to the navy, and as Lieutenant Commander he worked at the branch section of Admiral Office.

sen.j: 1881年に「日進」艦長に就任。
sen.e: In 1881, he assumed the post of the captain of "Nisshin".
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「日進 (巡洋艦)」をWeb原稿に合わせて「日進」に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1881, he assumed the post of the captain of 'Nisshin.'
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオート、ピリオドの位置変更しました。
sen.e: In 1881, he assumed the post of the captain of 'Nisshin.'

sen.j: 1882年には海軍大佐に昇進し、海防艦「比叡」、「筑波」の艦長を歴任する。
sen.e: In1882, he was promoted to Captain, and successively held the posts of the captain of Patrol boats "Hiei" and "Tsukuba".
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「比叡 (コルベット)」、「筑波 (コルベット)」をWeb原稿に合わせてそれぞれ「比叡」、「筑波」に訂正しました。
sen.e: In1882, he was promoted to Captain, and successively held the posts of the captain of Patrol boats 'Hiei' and 'Tsukuba.'
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオート、ピリオドの位置変更しました。
sen.e: In1882, he was promoted to Captain, and successively held the posts of the captain of Patrol boats 'Hiei' and 'Tsukuba.'

sen.j: 「筑波」艦長であった1884年、遠洋航海に出発した。
sen.e: In1884, when he was the captain of "Tsukuba", the ship went on ocean navigation.
In1884, when he was the captain of 'Tsukuba,' the ship went on ocean navigation.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオート、コンマの位置変更しました。
sen.e: In1884, when he was the captain of 'Tsukuba,' the ship went on ocean navigation.

sen.j: 前年の航海では乗組員に多数の脚気患者が発生し、23名が死亡していた。
sen.e: In the navigation of the previous year, a lot of crew members presented symptoms of beriberi, and twenty-three of them had died.
In the navigation of the previous year, a lot of crew members presented symptoms of beriberi, and twenty-three of them had died.
In the navigation of the previous year, a lot of crew members presented symptoms of beriberi, and twenty-three of them had died.

sen.j: そこで、海軍軍医・高木兼寛の指導で洋食を導入した結果、脚気患者の発生が激減し、一人の死者も出ることがなかった。
sen.e: So, as a result of introducing Western food under the guidance of a naval surgeon Kanehiro TAKAGI, the number of the beriberi sufferers decreased dramatically, and no one had died of beriberi.
So, as a result of introducing Western food under the guidance of a naval surgeon Kanehiro TAKAGI, the number of the beriberi sufferers decreased dramatically, and no one had died of beriberi.
So, as a result of introducing Western food under the guidance of a naval surgeon Kanehiro TAKAGI, the number of the beriberi sufferers decreased dramatically, and no one had died of beriberi.

sen.j: 1884年12月に軍事部（後の軍令部）次長となり、参謀本部海軍部第1局長を経て、1886年に海軍少将・横須賀軍港司令官、翌年まで海軍機関学校校長を兼務。
sen.e: In December, 1884, he was appointed as Vice-chief of Military Affairs Division (later Military Order Division), and after assuming the post of First Bureau Chief of the Navy Division of the Staff Headquarters, in 1886, he was promoted to Rear Admiral and Commander of the Yokosuka Naval Port, and until the next year he held the concurrent post of Commandant of Naval Engineering College.

In December, 1884, he was appointed as Vice-chief of Military Affairs Division (later Military Order Division), and after assuming the post of First Bureau Chief of the Navy Division of the Staff Headquarters, in 1886, he was promoted to Rear Admiral and Commander of the Yokosuka Naval Port, and until the next year he held the concurrent post of Commandant of Naval Engineering College.

In December, 1884, he was appointed as Vice-chief of Military Affairs Division (later Military Order Division), and after assuming the post of First Bureau Chief of the Navy Division of the Staff Headquarters, in 1886, he was promoted to Rear Admiral and Commander of the Yokosuka Naval Port, and until the next year he held the concurrent post of Commandant of Naval Engineering College.

sen.j: 1887年に海軍兵学校校長となり、教育に柔道を導入している。
sen.e: In 1887, he became Commandant of the Naval Academy, and introduced Judo (Japanese art of self-defense) into the educational curriculum.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「海軍兵学校 (日本)」をWeb原稿に合わせて「海軍兵学校」に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1887, he became Commandant of the Naval Academy, and introduced Judo (Japanese art of self-defense) into the educational curriculum.
In 1887, he became Commandant of the Naval Academy, and introduced Judo (Japanese art of self-defense) into the educational curriculum.

sen.j: 1889年から1891年まで海軍参謀部長、さらに常備艦隊長官を経て、1892年に海軍中将・呉鎮守府司令長官となり日清戦争を迎えた。
sen.e: From 1889 to 1891, he held the post of Chief of Naval Staff Officer Division, and after serving as Commander-in-Chief of the Readiness Fleet, in 1892, he was promoted to Vice Admiral and Commander-in-Chief of Kure Chinjufu (Kure Naval District) and reached Sino-Japanese War.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「軍令部」をWeb原稿に合わせて「海軍参謀部長」に訂正しました。
sen.e: From 1889 to 1891, he held the post of Chief of Naval Staff Officer Division, and after serving as Commander-in-Chief of the Readiness Fleet, in 1892, he was promoted to Vice Admiral and Commander-in-Chief of Kure Chinjufu (Kure Naval District) and reached Sino-Japanese War.

From 1889 to 1891, he held the post of Chief of Naval Staff Officer Division, and after serving as Commander-in-Chief of the Readiness Fleet, in 1892, he was promoted to Vice Admiral and Commander-in-Chief of Kure Chinjufu (Kure Naval District) and reached Sino-Japanese War.

sen.j: 1895年5月に再び常備艦隊長官となり連合艦隊司令長官を兼務した。
sen.e: In May, 1895, he assumed the post of Commander-in-Chief of the Readiness Fleet again, and held the concurrent post of Commander-in-Chief of the Combined Fleet.
In May, 1895, he assumed the post of Commander-in-Chief of the Readiness Fleet again, and held the concurrent post of Commander-in-Chief of the Combined Fleet.
In May, 1895, he assumed the post of Commander-in-Chief of the Readiness Fleet again, and held the concurrent post of Commander-in-Chief of the Combined Fleet.

sen.j: 同年10月、日本領となった台湾において、抵抗した中国人がイギリス商船「テールス号」に逃げたため、配下の「八重山 (通報艦)」がこれを追跡して臨検を行うという事件が起きた。
sen.e: In October of the same year, in Taiwan which had come into the possession of Japan, an incident happened in which because a resisting Chinese fled into a British merchant ship "Thales", Arichi's subordinate cruiser "Yaeyama" chased it and made an on-the-spot visitation of it.

In October of the same year, in Taiwan which had come into the possession of Japan, an incident happened in which because a resisting Chinese fled into a British merchant ship 'Thales,' Arichi's subordinate cruiser 'Yaeyama' chased it and made an on-the-spot visitation of it.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオート、コンマの位置変更しました。
sen.e: In October of the same year, in Taiwan which had come into the possession of Japan, an incident happened in which because a resisting Chinese fled into a British merchant ship 'Thales,' Arichi's subordinate cruiser 'Yaeyama' chased it and made an on-the-spot visitation of it.

sen.j: これが公海上で行われたことからイギリスから抗議を受け、外務省は海軍に対して責任者の処罰を要求した。
sen.e: Because this visitation was carried out on the open sea, the British authority made a protest to Japan, so Ministry of Foreign Affairs demanded that the Navy punish the responsible persons.
Because this visitation was carried out on the open sea, the British authority made a protest to Japan, so Ministry of Foreign Affairs demanded that the Navy punish the responsible persons.
Because this visitation was carried out on the open sea, the British authority made a protest to Japan, so Ministry of Foreign Affairs demanded that the Navy punish the responsible persons.

sen.j: その結果、有地と八重山艦長の平山藤次郎海軍大佐を予備役に編入することで解決が図られた。
sen.e: As a consequence, ARICHI and Captain Tojiro HIRAYAMA, the captain of Yaeyama, were made to transfer to the reserve duty to seek the resolution.
As a consequence, ARICHI and Captain Tojiro HIRAYAMA, the captain of Yaeyama, were made to transfer to the reserve duty to seek the resolution.
As a consequence, ARICHI and Captain Tojiro HIRAYAMA, the captain of Yaeyama, were made to transfer to the reserve duty to seek the resolution.

sen.j: 1896年に男爵に叙せられ、1897年から10年間、貴族院議員を務め、1917年に枢密顧問官となった。
sen.e: In 1896, he was raised to the peerage of Baron, and for ten years from 1897, he served as a member of the House of Peers, and in 1917, he was appointed as Privy Councilor.
In 1896, he was raised to the peerage of Baron, and for ten years from 1897, he served as a member of the House of Peers, and in 1917, he was appointed as Privy Councilor.
In 1896, he was raised to the peerage of Baron, and for ten years from 1897, he served as a member of the House of Peers, and in 1917, he was appointed as Privy Councilor.

sen.j: 1899年、帝国海事協会初代理事長となり、有栖川宮威仁親王を総裁に奉戴し、帝国義勇艦隊結成に尽くした。
sen.e: In 1899, he assumed the post of the first Administrative Director of Imperial Kaiji Kyokai (present-day Nippon Kaiji Kyokai, Japan Maritime Society), and made an effort to organize Imperial Fleet of Loyalty and Courage with Imperial Prince Takehito ARISUGAWANOMIYA as President.
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「日本海事協会」をWeb原稿に合わせて「帝国海事協会」に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1899, he assumed the post of the first Administrative Director of Imperial Kaiji Kyokai (present-day Nippon Kaiji Kyokai, Japan Maritime Society), and made an effort to organize Imperial Fleet of Loyalty and Courage with Imperial Prince Takehito ARISUGAWANOMIYA as President.

In 1899, he assumed the post of the first Administrative Director of Imperial Kaiji Kyokai (present-day Nippon Kaiji Kyokai, Japan Maritime Society), and made an effort to organize Imperial Fleet of Loyalty and Courage with Imperial Prince Takehito ARISUGAWANOMIYA as President.

sen.j: 青山墓地に葬られる。
sen.e: He was buried in the Aoyama-bochi Cemetery.
He was buried in the Aoyama-bochi Cemetery.
He was buried in the Aoyama-bochi Cemetery.

sen.j: 論説「海事ヲ論シテ教育家諸君ニ望ム」会員有地品之允、『大日本教育会雑誌』99、1890年8月15日
sen.e: A discourse 'Discussion about Maritime Affairs and Demand to Educators' by a member Shinanojo ARICHI, "Journal of the Educational Society of Japan" vol. 99, August 15, 1890
A discourse 'Discussion about Maritime Affairs and Demand to Educators' by a member Shinanojo ARICHI, "Journal of the Educational Society of Japan" vol. 99, August 15, 1890
A discourse 'Discussion about Maritime Affairs and Demand to Educators' by a member Shinanojo ARICHI, "Journal of the Educational Society of Japan" vol. 99, August 15, 1890

sen.j: 「明治24年4月11日 有地海軍中将 海防意見書」（伊藤博文編『秘書類纂 10 兵政関係資料』196-201頁）
sen.e: April 11, Meiji 24 (1891), Vice Admiral Arichi's Opinions about Naval Defense' ("Assorted Secret Documents 10 Resources about Military Policies" compiled by Hirobumi ITO, pp.196-201)
sen.cmt: 「明治24年」は意見書のタイトルの一部と思われるのでそのまま残し、年のために西暦をかっこではさんで挿入しました。
sen.e: April 11, Meiji 24 (1891), Vice Admiral Arichi's Opinions about Naval Defense' ("Assorted Secret Documents 10 Resources about Military Policies" compiled by Hirobumi ITO, pp.196-201)
April 11, Meiji 24 (1891), Vice Admiral Arichi's Opinions about Naval Defense' ("Assorted Secret Documents 10 Resources about Military Policies" compiled by Hirobumi ITO, pp.196-201)

sen.j: 論説「義勇艦隊建設について」男爵有地品之允、帝国海事協会機関誌『海事雑報』197、1905年2月10日
sen.e: A discourse 'About the Construction of Fleet of Loyalty and Courage' by Baron Shinanojo ARICHI, In-house magazine of Imperial Kaiji Kyokai "Miscellaneous News about Maritime Affairs" vol. 197, February 10, 1905
sen.cmt: Excel原稿の「日本海事協会」をWeb原稿に合わせて「帝国海事協会」に訂正しました。
sen.e: A discourse 'About the Construction of Fleet of Loyalty and Courage' by Baron Shinanojo ARICHI, In-house magazine of Imperial Kaiji Kyokai "Miscellaneous News about Maritime Affairs" vol. 197, February 10, 1905
